data.text: Then Job answered and said,
How long will ye vex my soul,
Ye speak against me; ye do not feel for me, but bear hard upon me.
Yea verily, I have erred in truth
In having spoken words which it was not right to speak;
But alas! for ye magnify yourselves against me,
Know then that it is the Lord that has troubled me,
Behold, I laugh at reproach; I will not speak:
I am fenced round about, and can by no means escape:
And he has stripped me of my glory,
He has torn me round about, and I am gone:
And he has dreadfully handled me in anger,
His troops also came upon me with one accord,
My brethren have stood aloof from me;
My nearest of kin have not acknowledged me,
As for my household, and my maidservants,
I called my servant, and he hearkened not;
And I besought my wife,
But they rejected me forever;
They that saw me abhorred me:
My flesh is corrupt under my skin,
Pity me, pity me, O friends;
Wherefore do ye persecute me as also the Lord does,
For oh that my words were written,
With an iron pen and lead,
For I know that he is eternal who is about to deliver me,
And to raise up upon the earth my skin that endures these sufferings:
Which I am conscious of in myself,
But if ye shall also say, What shall we say before him,
Do ye also beware of deceit:
